item.title: Git/posh-git commands
item.description: After frustration with GitHub for Windows, thanks to Google+ I've completely switched to posh-git. Here are the commands I end up using.

item.title: Brief thoughts after 1 month of GitHub
item.description: Very brief thoughts after about a month of GitHub.

item.title: Importing an existing Web site into Subversion
item.description: In this article I move one of my smaller sites into Subversion, and work through making a change.

item.title: Playing around with Subversion with a test repository
item.description: In this article I'll be working through creating a test repository in Subversion, and creating two working directories, to see how multiple developers works.

item.title: Review of Steve Krug's Don't Make Me Think: 2nd Edition (with notes)
item.description: A review of Steve Krug's Don't Make Me Think: 2nd Edition, plus my notes on the book.

item.title: Version control systems - any suggestions?
item.description: Version control is something that I've been interested in for the past several months but that I haven't been able to dig into as much as I'd like. I'm looking for recommendations on software that will help me get a system setup for some testing. Recommendations? Thoughts? Rants? Raves?

item.title: Logical coding
item.description: When it comes to proper coding, you should know the most important rule of all; LIFO. However, not even LIFO nor the W3C can really tell you which order to put certain elements. In the nature of Web 2.0, I'll discuss some of the standards I've been bouncing around for HTML text markup when the same text is given multiple attributes.
